rules: Rule1: Either a person attends a show or a person presents an artwork.

Rule2: Provided that a curator makes a decision about an artwork, either there is an alternative show or, if the artwork is approved, then whenever the show is scheduled, it follows that if a person attends the show, the show is successful.
Rule3: Whenever a safety check is performed on a device, the device is not powered on.
Rule4: If an inspection is performed on a device, then a safety check is performed on the device.
Rule5: Should a person present an artwork, the show is successful.
Rule6: Either a device is powered on or the show is successful.
Rule7: A device malfunctions or it is not the case that the device is powered on.
Rule8: In the event that a device is repaired, the device does not malfunction.
Rule9: If it is not the case that a person attending a show implies the show is successful, then a device has a technical issue.
Rule10: Should it not be true that a person attending a show leads to the show being successful, then a device does not have a technical issue.
facts: Fact1: A curator makes a decision about an artwork.
Fact2: An inspection is performed on a device.
Fact6: There is no alternative show.
